runs.comm: good length to start with, gets the ball to drift in after pitching, defended to the off side
bang on target, on middle stump, Vincent gets a good stride forward and defends
New Zealand are underway, good length on off stump, Vincent defends with soft hands to the on side and both set off quickly
defended on the front foot towards mid-off, the ball travels quickly off the bat, they contemplate a single
in target again, on middle stump, McCullum goes forward and defends back to Pollock
good length outside off, McCullum gets a big stride forward and pushes to cover, the calling is good as they complete the run easily
top edge and streaky! McCullum tries to work the ball to the on side, he gets a big leading edge and the ball loops up towards mid-off, lucky to get away with it
drifting on the pads at a good pace, the ball clips the top half of the pad
misfield: fuller and driven to mid-on, the fielder runs towards it and ends up overrunning it, the ball deflects off his palm to his left, allows them to complete a second run
beaten, raw pace, outside off, the ball kicks off a good length and goes through to Boucher at shoulder height
punched to the off side for a single
good length outside off, Vincent goes on the backfoot and punches to cover
away swinger outside off, McCullum has a feel for it, the swing takes it away
good length outside off, no room to cut, McCullum plays it back to Pollock
McCullum has enough of messing around, he charges down the track and lofts Pollock over extra cover
On the roof! full and on the pads, McCullum stays at the wicket and lofts over deep midwicket, the ball goes into orbit and lands on the roof
punched to cover for a easy single, Pollock's fine figures have been disturbed
just short of a length, pulled away fiercely, the ball rockets to deep square leg

chance but the ball drops short! McCullum swings and the ball gets the outside edge and flies to third man, the ball just drops once bounce to him, he does well to stop that from rolling over to the boundary
pushed back to the bowler
Nel responds with a bouncer outside off, Vincent has a wild swings at it and misses
take that! full, on off stump, Vincent backs away and clubs it past Nel, the ball goes racing away to the straight boundary
this time he slips in a fast low full toss, Vuncent backs away and but the ball gets the toe edge of the bat and goes to Nel
off cutter, McCullum gets down and slog sweeps it over the deep midwicket boundary, the ball just lands over the rope
Pollock slips in a full toss, McCullum waits on it and pushes it firmly to the left of mid-on, offers the full face of the bat
drifting on the pads and flicked to the on side
Vincent takes a few paces forward to disturb Pollock's rhythm, Pollock responds by bowling a slow bouncer which kicks and beats Vincent
full and driven firmly past mid-on, the fielder throws himself to his right but he isnt quick enough to cut it off
another slow bouncer, beats him outside off, just a little too wide though, perhaps a tad harsh on the bowler
full and driven towards midwicket
Vincent shows his intent by backing away to the leg side and swinging across the line, the ball gets the under half of the bat and goes to deep square leg
slower ball, slips out of Nel's hand and the ball goes high outside the off stump, catches McCullum off guard, he somehow pushes it to mid-on and sets off
turned towards square leg, a bit of slack fielding results in an extra run
full, Vincent moves to the leg stump and clubs that along the ground to the left of Nel, no chance of anyone stopping that
short of a length outside off and punched to cover
raw pace again, thudded in around off stump, Vincent tries to pull but doesnt read the length early enough, beaten all ends up
outside off, tries to slash and beaten
Morkel drifts on the body, turned towards fine leg, good sliding stop near the boundary
good length, on the channel outside off, McCullum fancies his chances with a cover drive, gets beaten
McCullum attempts another cover drive, this time he gets bat on it but it's an outside edge which flies past the vacant slip region
good length, on the pads, pushed to mid-on
overpitched, outside off, Vincent gets forward and launches into an uppish cover drive, the fielder at deep extra cover cuts it off
sliding down the leg side, errs in length, wide called
good length, on off and middle, pushed back to the bowler
good length on middle and leg, turned off the pads to square leg
short of a length on off stump, backs away and flat-bats it over cover, the ball goes on the first bounce to deep cover
backs away and pulled past midwicket, quite a few fielders patroling the boundary now
slowish bouncer outside off, just a little wide, Vincent in the last second decides to leave it, van der Wath isnt too happy with the call

played to the on side, strange looking stroke as Vincent walks across his stumps and the ball gets the thin edge of the bat and rolls to the on side, Vincent looked like losing his balance on that one
punched hard to cover
full, on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
Morkel strikes! pitched up on off stump, McCullum gives room and tries to drive through cover, fails to get to the pitch of it, the ball gets a thick outside edge and goes to Boucher
fullish and driven confidently to the bowler
full, on off stump, Taylor drives on the frontfoot to backward point, good work by Gibbs to cut that off
dabbed to third man off an open face
double strike by Morkel! short of a length on off stump, the ball cuts in a touch, Taylor tries to cut square and gets a thin edge through to Boucher
good length, fired in on off stump, played back to the bowler
that was way wide outside off, the batsman had to really reach out to it, cuts past cover
beaten, fired in outside off, kicks off a good length, chin music for Styris
fired in on middle and leg, Styris glances to the on side on the hop
Vincent stands a couple of paces in front of the crease, picks a full length delivery on leg stump and lofts over midwicket, plenty of confidence on that stroke
van der wath strikes! Vincent backs away and misses completely, the ball clips the top of the stumps and the bails go flying
full in length, on the off stump, steered to point where de Villiers dives to makes a a fine stop, recovers quickly to fire in a throw
lands on a length, around the off stump, holds up on Craig McMillan who pushes at it and the ball bobs down the track. Doesn't carry to the bowler
Here comes the wild slog. He swats a length delivery on the off stump, just over cover.
banged in short - one bouncer for the over - just outside the off stump, Styris goes for a pull and the ball flashes over the blade
fullish, outside the off stump, in the slot and Styris drives to left of long-off and has enough time to come back for the second run
drifting onto the pads, flicked past square leg.

Almost caught by Smith at midwicket. It was full in length, on the middle stump line, again holds up a touch and Styris checks his intended drive and the ball lobs towards mid-on. Smith rushes after it from his position at midwicket and dives with his left hand stretched out but can't hold on
Six over extra cover. McMillan backed away to the leg-side and carved a full-pitched delivery over extra cover.
length delivery on the middle and leg, driven to long-on
attempted yorker turns into a low full toss, just outside the off stump, driven to long-off for a single.
The elder brother joins in the fun. Full in length and Styris slices it, off the bottom-half of the bat, straight to de Villiers at long-on.
length delivery outside off, McMillan waits on the ball before steering it to third man
bouncer on the left shoulder and Oram ducks under
short in length, moving across Oram who defends to the off side. Good tight over this. Just one run so far.
Oram backs to the leg-side, Albie follows him with a short-of-length delivery at the body and Oram pushes it to right of backward point
lovely delivery to start off the spell. Screaming through the zone outside off and Oram can't lay his bat on it
Ah! Fab placement. It was really full and outside off, Oram bent towards the line and chopped it to right of backward point and he gets himself a boundary to the wide third man region.
Nel responds with a bouncer. Over the middle and off, Oram sways away
Another short-pitched delivery. Oram lets it fly past him.
fuller, outside off stump, Oram clears the front foot by taking it outside leg stump and slices the ball over cover point
yorker on the middle stump line, stabbed back to Nel who picks up the ball and stares at the batsman. Nothing new. He does that for a living.

slower one, off short of length, tapped close towards backward point and they rush across for a quick single. de Villiers fires in a throw at the striker's end but he misses. Had he hit, McMillan would be back in the dug-out
full and straight, swiped across the line and it falls just short of Kemp at midwicket
short in length and outside the off stump, Oram slaps it past point. 100 up for NZ
full and angling away from Oram who again clears the front foot and drills it to long-off
Disappears over long-on boundary. Full in length, on the off and middle, McMillan opens his stance and smokes it over the boundary. That was a big hit. And here comes the free hit. What would he do?
Lap shot over the short fine leg.. Cute and cheeky. Short in length on the leg and middle, McMillan paddle-scoops it over the fielder at short fine leg
full-pitched, on the stumps, the left foot goes outside legstump and the bat swings through the line cleanly and the ball sails over the long-on boundary. The fun has begun.
yorker length, Oram digs it out one-handed and the ball rolls towards mid-off. McMillan on strike now.
Ah! the slower bouncer. Wide called, though. It looped ever so slowly high over McMillan's head.
goes for the yorker, a low dipping full toss is the result and McMillan works it past square leg
yorker on the off stump, again Oram jabs it away one-handed and again towards mid-off for a single.

Agony for Pollock. The good old lemon-cut or French cut. as you please. Screaming yorker on the leg stump line, McMillan stabs at it in a hurry, the ball collides with the inside-edge and runs past the leg stump and past a diving Boucher
charges out, Pollock fires in the blockhole, dug out for a single
Meanwhile nothing has changed when Oram bats. Pollock pings the blockhole, Oram digs it out one-handed.
Timber! Oram backs away to the leg-side, the ball heads towards the middle stump and he couldn't connect with his swipe across the line. Gone.
in the region outside off stump, beaten
low dipping full toss, on the off stump line, pushed to cover
In the zone outside off, Nathan goes for a big swing over cover but no luck. He doesn't make contact.

A run out now. South Africa are applying the squeeze. Full and drifting to the pads, Nathan misses his flick shot and the ball goes towards fine leg. Van der Wath swoops on the ball and fires in an accurate throw to Boucher who whips the bails off. Nathan is short of the crease. Run out in his first international game.
full and outside off, swing and a miss.
full in length, on the off stump line, pushed to cover point
on the off stump line, short in length, chopped down to third man
full-pitched outside off, driven past cover
almost at the blockhole, on the middle and leg, jabbed back the bowler who makes a half-stop

The brothers are having a party. It's either bowled or caught Morkel. Short in length, on the middle and leg, pulled to left of midwicket where Albie takes a step before flinging himself in the air and catches it with both hands.
fullish, on the middle, driven to long-on. Importantly, McMillan will be on strike
low full toss, driven down the ground for just a single.

Morne picks his fourth wicket. Wonder what the brothers ate today. It kicks up from short of length, outside the off stump, holds its line and all Bond could offer was a poke. Fatal as Boucher dives to his right to take a sharp catch
full and just outside the off stump, Gillespie's feet go nowhere and he pushes inside the line and is beaten
rears up from short of length, screams past the outside edge  that Gillespie had helpfully stretched out
Arrggh! The yorker takes out the off stump but umpire Doctrove stretched his hand out. No ball!
another yorker, on the off stump, jabbed away to cover point
low full toss, driven down the ground. Last over coming up.
yorker length, on the middle stump line, driven for a single
Gillespie stands outside the crease, moves to the leg-side and hits a length delivery to long-on. McMillan back on strike. What will he do?
Ah! he decides to top edge over the 'keeper's head for six. It was a slower ball, short in length and McMillan was through with his pull shot early but gets away with a six.
yorker, on the middle stump, dug out to the on side for a single
low swinging full-toss, just past the leg stump, Gillespie shuffled towards the off stump and tried to paddle it past the short fine leg but made no contact. Now the fine leg drops back
yorker, on the middle stump line, stabbed back to the bowler, who makes a half-stop to his left. Gillespie wants a single, McMillan doesn't want to take the risk and they end up with nothing.
low full-toss on the stumps, swiped to the on side for a single. NZ end up on 153.
